PARAGRAPH.STRING: is an active ice-covered volcano located in Chilean Patagonia, in the northern part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field.
summit rises more than 1000 m above the average surface of the ice cap plateau.
is the tallest mountain in Bernardo O'Higgins National Park and in

name in honor of Lautaro, who was a Mapuche military leader.

was made by Peter Skvarca and Luciano Pera, on January 29, 1964. They climbed the southeast ridge, encountering many crevasses, some steep ice walls, cornices, and a snow mushroom at the summit. They found an active crater and strong sulfurous emissions near the summit. The second ascent was made by Eric Jones, Mick Coffey, and Leo Dickinson on March 2, 1973, as part of a crossing of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field.
